intro: Melandrium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides.
